https://twitter.com/wetgenes/status/1434524097548111873 M and ] are suspiciously only 1 bit different, so I guess that was probably a disk corruption?

It was one of them newfangled NVMe drives.

Probably doesn't help that its inside an arm qemu machine, plenty of levels here for things to go wrong.

Well this is a new one, looks like git decided to replace an M with a ] on checkout.

I blame the blockchain.

../lib_jpeg/jpeg/jidctint.c:2578:11: error: ‘RANGE_’ undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean ‘RANGE_MASK’? & RANGE_]ASK];

https://twitter.com/IcepickInTheory/status/1432879801396772864 @IcepickInTheory Its a reskin/rebuild of Mutant year zero, so a further iteration of the same design. A bit lacking in character, especially compared to the original.

That ambush style would have been a much nicer fit to xcom2 compared to all the nudges they used to encourage faster play.
